body: I don't think we changed something related to Stork but I need to check. Now, Stork can be used at runtime (programmatically) so it would need to be initialized - what's surprising is that it was not before.
And it's also not in latest 3.21.2 ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
@rsvoboda I see the exact same behavior in 3.20 and 3.21 and from what I can tell, this is the proper behavior as REST Client depends on Stork.
@rsvoboda I didn't use a flamegraph, I used a debugger

issue.title: Do not initialize Stork if there's no config
issue.body:
Fixes #47337

@cescoffier @aureamunoz it somehow makes sense but maybe there are other ways to configure Stork and you need to initialize it always?

body: I created https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/47428 in case it makes sense...

issue.title: Make Stork optional for REST Client
issue.body:
If you want to use Stork, you now have to add the quarkus-smallrye-stork extension, which IMHO makes perfect sense.

This avoids initializing Stork for every application using the REST Client.

I tested several ITs both in JVM and native and it looked fine. Let's hope CI will agree.

Fixes #47337

body:
I went with another approach here: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/47435 .

I agree with @rsvoboda than having Stork as a hard dependency of the REST Client and initializing it for every application using the REST Client is something we should fix.

FWIW, it's also a hard dependency of the gRPC extension, I will have a quick look at if we can improve things there here or not.
